business.headline: India–EU FTA: Why is the 'Mother of All Deals' India's global moment?At a time when protectionism and economic nationalism are resurging globally, the India–EU FTA demonstrates that large economies can still choose cooperation over confrontation. It reflects confidence in India's macroeconomic stability, regulatory predictability, and reform trajectory.

Indonesia's richest man loses nearly $9 billion in a day. Here's whyThe biggest loss was suffered by Prajogo Pangestu, Indonesia's richest person. His net worth fell by around $9 billion after shares of his energy and mining companies dropped sharply.

Gold crosses Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh: 4 key reasons for the surgeThe unstoppable gold and silver rally has been fuelled by global uncertainty, strong demand and powerful technical momentum that have kept precious metals on an unbroken upward run.

Economic Survey 2026: What to expect and why it's importantThis year's Economic Survey comes at a time when the global environment remains unpredictable. Geopolitical tensions, volatile commodity prices, fluctuating interest rate expectations, and uneven global growth continue to influence economic outcomes for emerging markets.

Silver crosses Rs 4 lakh per kg: Here's what buyers should knowA major reason behind the spike is growing concern about a silver shortage. Global inventories have been tightening because demand from industries has grown faster than supply. Silver is used in solar panels, electric vehicles, electronics and high-tech manufacturing.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt 10:10 am, the Sensex was down 560 points, or 0.68%, at 81,784.28, and the Nifty fell 158 points to 25,184.30, slipping below key intraday support.

Economic Survey 2026 Live: Nirmala Sitharaman tables Economic SurveyEconomic Survey Live Updates: The Economic Survey is an annual review of India's economy, looking at how the economy performed over the past year. It is prepared by the Department of Economic Affairs under the guidance of the Chief Economic Adviser and published by the Ministry of Finance.

Rupee slips to an all-time low of Rs 92 against dollar, declined 2% this yearThe rupee fell to 91.9850 against the dollar, crossing its previous all-time low of 91.9650 touched last week. This marked the first time the currency has moved so close to the 92 level.
Sensex, Nifty open lower ahead of Budget, rupee falls to all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 275 points to 82,069.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48 points to 25,294.75 as of 9:25 am.

US Fed holds key interest rates: Will Dalal Street cheer or stay cautious?The US Federal Reserve held key interest rates steady and Dalal Street is expected to react to it. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,371 around 8:30 AM. This indicates an opening close to Wednesday's Nifty 50 closing level of 25,342.75.

Saudi Arabia turns to wealthy families in fresh push to raise new funds: ReportSaudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund, held a meeting last month with around a dozen of the kingdom's most prominent families on the Red Sea coast.

US Federal Reserve holds rates, Powell cites improving economic outlookThe Federal Reserve held interest rates steady, citing improved economic conditions and a stabilising job market, while signalling openness to cuts later this year once inflation shows clearer signs of easing.

Budget 2026: Can India fix renewable energy's storage and reliability gap?Sustained support for storage, critical minerals and local manufacturing could help India build a self-reliant and competitive clean energy ecosystem, say experts.

Budget 2026: Why India's VDA tax framework needs a strategic recalibrationAs policymakers consider Budget 2026, it is timely to assess whether the current tax design continues to align with the framework's original objectives, given global market and regulatory developments.

India–EU FTA to strengthen jobs, and drive growth, says President MurmuThe President said that the India–EU free trade agreement would provide a strong push for the manufacturing and services sectors and help generate fresh employment opportunities for the country's youth.

How mis-selling and low surrender values are costing life insurance buyers dearlyMis-selling pulls families into long-term commitments, and low surrender values lock them in. Until these rules change, life insurance will remain a product where many lose more than they gain.

Budget 2026: Will new tax slabs ease the burden on middle-income taxpayers?As Budget 2026 approaches, middle-income taxpayers are watching closely for signs of relief. With rising costs and inflation pressures, the big question is whether the government will tweak tax slabs to ease the burden.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as mood turns positive ahead of Budget sessionThe Nifty50 closed 0.66% higher at 25,342.75, while the BSE Sensex gained 0.6% to end at 82,344.68. With this rise, both benchmark indices have added close to 1% over the last two trading sessions.

Is Budget 2026 ready to address startups' compliance, funding and tech gaps?As expectations rise ahead of Budget 2026, startup founders and investors are watching closely to see whether policy announcements will finally ease compliance pressures, unlock domestic capital and strengthen India's technology backbone.

India needs an hourly wage structure before it needs a right to disconnectA right to disconnect sounds progressive, but without a transparent hourly wage structure for white collar professionals, it may end up doing the opposite of what it intends.

entertainment.headline: Orry claims trauma, but what did Amrita Singh do? Inside besties to beef drama Orry has accused Amrita Singh of causing him emotional trauma and claims she owes him an apology. The influencer has also opened up about his fallout with Sara Ali Khan and Ibrahim Ali Khan, but where did Amrita come into the picture?

Kamal Haasan thanks Linkin Park for taking his khadi brand global Actor Kamal Haasan has thanked the band Linkin Park for publicly endorsing his Khaddar/Khadi clothing brand, following the band's recent appearance in India wearing the label.

Bruce Willis doesn't know he has dementia, wife Emma Heming says Emma Heming Willis shared insight into Bruce Willis's experience with frontotemporal dementia. She revealed that he is not aware of his diagnosis due to a neurological condition and discussed how the family continues to adapt and support him during his health challenges.

Taylor Swift's performing at 2026 Grammys? Producer addresses rumours Grammy Awards executive producer Ben Winston clarified that Taylor Swift is not scheduled to perform or attend the 2026 ceremony, directly addressing speculation fuelled by unsubstantiated media reports.

Vijay's controversy trail: From Sura to Jana Nayagan, trouble has followed him Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan is in a legal standoff with the Central Board of Film Certification. But, controversies are not new to Vijay, whose career has navigated its fair share of troubles over the years.

Bhumi Pednekar calls for accountability after distressing Delhi minor gang-rape case Actor Bhumi Pednekar has expressed her distress and anger following reports of a six-year-old girl allegedly gang-raped by three boys, aged 10, 13, and 14, in Delhi. She questioned society's failure to address sexual violence.

Did Arijit Singh's playback exit have Border 2 link? Producer Bhushan Kumar replies Producer Bhushan Kumar responded to allegations suggesting that Arijit Singh was compelled to perform Ghar Kab Aaoge in Border 2. The singer recently opened up about the multiple reasons behind his departure from playback singing.

Kannada actor Mayur Patel accused of drunk driving after multi-car crash, case filed Sandalwood actor Mayur Patel was involved in a late-night drink-and-drive accident in Bengaluru. Police have seized his vehicle and launched an investigation into the chain collision incident.

Keerthy Suresh talks about the moment Antony teared up during wedding ceremony Actor Keerthy Suresh reflected on her wedding with Antony Thattil, describing the poignant moment he tied the thaali and teared up for the first time.

Kohrra Season 2 trailer: Barun Sobti and Mona Singh take on a foggy new case The trailer of Kohrra Season 2 featuring a gripping murder mystery in Dalerpura was unveiled today. The new season explores complex investigations and personal traumas, promising a darker narrative.

What's delaying Hera Pheri 3? Paresh Rawal points to Akshay Kumar Paresh Rawal confirmed that 'Hera Pheri 3' will go ahead, attributing the film's delay to a technical issue involving Akshay Kumar and the producers.

Rob Schneider, wife Patricia end 16-year marriage, divorce filed: Report Patricia Azarcoya Schneider filed for divorce from comedian Rob Schneider after 16 years of marriage, according to court records from Arizona. The couple, who married in 2010 and share two children, have requested confidentiality for their legal documents.

Rajinikanth's autobiography in the works: Daughter Soundarya drops big update Soundarya Rajinikanth has officially revealed that her father, Superstar Rajinikanth, is personally writing his autobiography, promising previously untold details about his life and career.

Disha Patani's sister recalls Army days after Border 2, praises Varun Dhawan Disha Patani's sister Khushboo Patani reflected on her military experiences after watching 'Border 2', as the film received rave reviews from fans and celebs.

Does Nicola Peltz get $1 million a month from her father? Here's what we know Amid the Beckham family dispute, Nicola Peltz's supposed million-dollar monthly allowance from her father, Nelson Peltz, has come to light. Are the rumours true? Here's what we know.

Anurag Basu on Arijit Singh's retirement from playback: He wishes to do more Filmmaker Anurag Basu reacted to Arijit Singh's recent announcement of stepping away from playback singing, revealing the singer's interest in filmmaking and his aspirations beyond music.

Border 2 box office Day 6: Sunny Deol's war drama sees a drop on first Wednesday Border 2 earned approximately Rs Rs 15.04 crore on its sixth day at the Indian box office, marking a slowdown after a robust opening weekend. The Hindi-language war drama saw a dip in occupancy rates, with night shows registering the highest attendance.

Border 2: A partial remake in the guise of a sequel? Border 2, starring Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Diljit Dosanjh and Ahan Shetty, thrives on nostalgia and high-octane action, delivering emotional stakes and patriotic fervour, but does it tread too closely to the original?

Kim Kardashian clears air on Meghan, Prince Harry photo removal: It was innocent Kim Kardashian addressed the recent controversy over deleted social media photos of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry at Kris Jenner's 70th birthday. She clarified the timeline and reasoning behind the decision on a recent podcast.

general news.headline: Goodbye, Dada: Ajit Pawar cremated with full state honours in BaramatiAjit Pawar, ex-Maharashtra Deputy CM, cremated in Baramati with full state honours

Live: 'Ajit Dada amar rahe' chants ring out as Ajit Pawar cremated with state honoursAjit Pawar Funeral Live Updates: Ajit Pawar, the Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra and a senior NCP leader, was cremated on Thursday, a day after he was killed in a plane crash. Thousands gathered at Baramati, his ancestral stronghold, where the cremation took place, as chants of "Ajit Dada Amar Rahe" reverberated through the air. Several senior leaders, including Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, BJP chief Nitin Nabin, and NCP patriarch Sharad Pawar, attended the last rites. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for live updates from Baramati.

Oh s***: Crew's last words before Ajit Pawar's plane crashedA senior DGCA official privy to the Baramati plane crash probe confirmed that the final words from the crew were "Oh S***..," noting that the aircraft crashed short of the runway but within the airstrip. The official also confirmed the Learjet's black box has been recovered.

After Musk's 'half-Indian partner' defence, Indian-origin billionaire's comebackIndian-American billionaire Vinod Khosla and Tesla boss Elon Musk have been engaged in an on-and-off online feud for months. In the latest clash, Khosla accused Musk of being a racist and trying to promote Waga – white America great again. Musk dismissed it by citing his partner, Shivon Zills's Indian heritage.

Why BJP is facing the heat over UGC's caste equity rulesThe BJP, which receives solid support from upper caste groups, is facing pushback over the UGC's new equity norms to deal with caste-based discrimination in higher educational institutions. This is why the BJP is being faulted for the UGC's new norms.

IAF's R-Day video rekindles buzz about strikes at Pak's Kirana Hills nuclear siteSatellite imagery implied strikes on Mushaf airbase in Sargodha, reportedly linked to underground nuclear storage locations beneath the Kirana Hills.

Orry claims trauma, but what did Amrita Singh do? Inside besties to beef dramaOrry has accused Amrita Singh of causing him emotional trauma and claims she owes him an apology. The influencer has also opened up about his fallout with Sara Ali Khan and Ibrahim Ali Khan, but where did Amrita come into the picture?

Double-digit temperatures, single-digit chill: Why Delhi feels so cold todayThis fog episode and the incoming weather pattern are part of a brutal winter season that has gripped North India since late December 2025.

Spanish team cures pancreatic cancer in mice: Here's how they did itLed by renowned cancer biologist Mariano Barbacid, the researchers have managed to make pancreatic tumours completely and permanently disappear in experimental models.

Indian-origin US cyber agency chief shared sensitive documents on ChatGPT: ReportMadhu Gottumukkala, the acting director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), shared contracting and cybersecurity-related materials with the AI platform last summer for work purposes.

Live: Supreme Court to hear plea challenging new UGC guidelines shortlyUGC Equity Rules hearing LIVE: The Supreme Court on Thursday will hear a public interest litigation over UGC's new regulations on caste discrimination, which it has argued are unfair towards general category students. The top court had, on Wednesday, agreed on an urgent listing of the plea. "We are also aware of what's happening...It will be listed...You cure defects [in the PIL]," the bench, headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, said. The new rules mandate all higher educational institutions to form equity committees to look into discrimination complaints and promote equity. However, criticis flagged that the regulations lack prominent safeguards and could be misapplied wihout due process, especially against general category students. The petitions have been filed by Mritunjay Tiwari, Advocate Vineet Jindal and Rahul Dewan. A bench comprising Justice Joymalya Bagchi and Chief Justice Surya Kant will hear the case. Stay tuned to Indiatoday.in for live updates.

A crisis in BJP-Sena alliance over BMC mayor post and the Bal Thackeray linkThere are cracks in Maharashtra's ruling Mahayuti alliance over the BMC Mayor's post. The Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena wants the post on a rotational basis, especially because this is Bal Thackeray's birth centenary year. An Uddhav Thackeray camp leader, using the same centenary occasion, urged Shinde to join forces with Shiv Sena (UBT).

Producer Bhushan Kumar repliesProducer Bhushan Kumar responded to allegations suggesting that Arijit Singh was compelled to perform Ghar Kab Aaoge in Border 2. The singer recently opened up about the multiple reasons behind his departure from playback singing.

BJP's Saurav Joshi wins Chandigarh Mayor electionBJP candidate Saurav Joshi won the Chandigarh mayoral election with 18 votes after Congress and AAP failed to coordinate, allowing the saffron party to secure a majority in the municipal corporation.

High Court dismisses Sameer Wankhede's Ba***ds of Bollywood defamation suitIn 2021, ex-Narcotics Control Bureau officer Sameer Wankhede made news for arresting Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan for alleged possession, consumption and trafficking of drugs.

How EU Chief got Indian fashion right, unlike many othersFrom honouring the weavers of Varanasi in a brocade bandhgala jacket to twinning with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a Northeastern eri silk stole, Ursula von der Leyen made a strong case for fashion diplomacy without going overboard.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

8th Pay Commission: A look at real salary hikes so far and what may come nextWith the 8th Pay Commission expected to submit its recommendations in the coming months, attention has turned to the pattern of real salary hikes over the years. A look at earlier pay commissions offers useful clues about what employees may realistically expect this time.

After T20 World Cup boycott, Bangladesh clears shooting team's India travelDespite boycotting the T20 World Cup in India over security concerns, the Bangladesh government has approved its shooting team's travel to New Delhi, citing the small size of the contingent and the controlled, indoor nature of the event.

Why the red sky over Ladakh is a warning India can't ignoreThe red auroras over Hanle are a stunning visual of intense solar activity. These celestial displays are a warning for India's satellites and power grids.

What's delaying Hera Pheri 3? Paresh Rawal points to Akshay KumarParesh Rawal confirmed that 'Hera Pheri 3' will go ahead, attributing the film's delay to a technical issue involving Akshay Kumar and the producers.

Good morning: Pilot's last message to grandma before Ajit Pawar plane crashA Learjet 45 aircraft carrying Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar crashed near Baramati airport on Wednesday, resulting in the deaths of all five on board, including co-pilot Shambhavi Pathak.

Man spots bank details on street food paper plate, internet flags data privacy riskA man shared a picture of how bank documents were reused as roadside food plates in India, which raised serious questions about data privacy and paper disposal practices.

sports.headline: Women's Singles semi-final: Sabalenka takes on Svitolina in electric semis clash Australian Open Live, Women's Singles semi-final: We are set for an electrifying semi-finals clash in the Australian Open. Aryna Sabalenka takes on Ukraine's Elina Svitolina. This will be followed up by a clash between the 5th seed and the 6th seed - Elena Rybakina and Jessica Pegula.

Cricket nomads: Meet the jersey sellers who travel India match by match Behind the billion-dollar world of official kits, a nomadic tribe of sellers follows the cricket calendar by rail. Travelling from Bihar, Mumbai and Kolkata to the rest of the country, these daily-wage labourers clothe the masses, navigating thin margins and brand crackdowns to keep the stadium blue.

ICC suspends USA batter on corruption charges right ahead of T20 World Cup USA batter and former captain Aaron Jones has been suspended after facing match-fixing charges. The ICC says the case is part of a wider investigation, putting Jones' T20 World Cup future in doubt.USA cricket's World Cup preparations.

Rohit Sharma points out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World Cup Former India captain Rohit Sharma has pointed out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World Cup. Rohit has said that India need to get their combinations right in the tournament.

Abhishek Sharma and the T20 World Cup risk: Ajinkya Rahane warns India batters Ajinkya Rahane feels Abhishek Sharma's high-risk style will force India's batters to take responsibility. Despite the Vizag loss, Rahane believes such intent will better prepare India for T20 World Cup pressure.

UCL: Lamine praises resilient Barcelona as team finishes top 5 in league phase Champions League: Barcelona's Lamine Yamal praised the team's resilient show on the final day of the league phase. Barcelona overturned a 0-1 deficit and beat Copenhagen 4-1 at Camp Nou.

Kuldeep Yadav Lite: Meet Murali, teenage spinner shaped by YouTube and ambition India vs New Zealand: In the heart of Vizag, a 19-year-old from Srikakulam is turning heads. Meet Ronanki Murali, the 'Kuldeep Yadav Lite' who traded a pacer's run-up for a spinner's guile, using YouTube to mirror his idol and test visiting batters in the city.

Sophie Molineux announced Alyssa Healy's heir as Australia's all-format captain Sophie Molineux has been named Alyssa Healy's successor as Australia's all-format captain. The left-arm spinner will begin her leadership stint in the T20Is against India ahead of the World Cup.

Tyson Fury un-retires again: Gypsy King back for Netflix clash vs Makhmudov Tyson Fury has come out of retirement once again to return to the ring in April. The former heavyweight champion will face Arslanbek Makhmudov in a Netflix-broadcast bout in the UK.

Shivam Dube not just a finisher anymore: Gavaskar hails India's T20 World Cup weapon Sunil Gavaskar believes Shivam Dube has evolved into a complete T20I weapon for India. Despite the Vizag loss, the former captain feels Dube's growth with bat and ball is a major boost.

Real Madrid, PSG forced into UEFA Champions League playoff: Full knockouts list Real Madrid and PSG face an unexpected detour after slipping into the Champions League playoff round. A final night, sparked by Mourinho's Benfica drama, reshaped Europe's knockout picture.

Shivam Utlility Vehicle: How a mindset shift unlocked Dube's all-round beast modeShivam Dube is slowly morphing himself into one of India's most dependable players in the T20I setup. With a mindset shift, defined role and improved bowling, Dube is showing his true all-round value ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

PAK vs AUS: Full schedule, squads, livestreaming details and all you need to knowPAK vs AUS: Pakistan and Australia begin a three-match T20I series in Lahore from January 29, serving as key preparation for the T20 World Cup 2026, with several senior players missing from both squads.

Pakistan book Colombo flight tickets after T20 World Cup boycott antics: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan cricket team have been advised to stay prepared for the T20 World Cup after reportedly being advised not to boycott the tournament.

Playing India at home, no better test for New Zealand ahead of T20 World Cup 2026New Zealand captain, Mitchell Santner, believes that playing India on their home turf gives them the best form of preparation going into the T20 World Cup 2026.

Shivam Dube's sixer-fest not enough as India's T20I freight train halts in VizagIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I: Shivam Dube's 15-ball fifty — a six-hitting freak show — was the lone bright spot for India on Tuesday in Visakhapatnam. Their impressive run of muscle-flexing performances came to an end as New Zealand successfully defended 215 to clinch a morale-boosting victory in the five-match series.

Shivam Dube hits 3rd fastest T20I fifty by an Indian, gets dismissed in cruel twistShivam Dube blazes to India's third-fastest T20I fifty against New Zealand in Vizag, scoring 65 off 23 in a thrilling chase. However, he was dismissed in the end in a cruel twist in Vizag.

Australian Open 2026 women's singles semi-final: When and where to watchAustralian Open 2026: The women's singles semifinals at Melbourne Park feature a blockbuster final four, with Aryna Sabalenka, Elina Svitolina, Elena Rybakina, and Jessica Pegula all arriving in strong form at Melbourne Park.

IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson's Vizag T20I ends in another missed opportunitySanju Samson's poor run of form continues as he was dismissed for 24 off 16 balls during the Vizag T20I. Samson made a good start and failed to push on and get a big score.

After T20 World Cup boycott, Bangladesh clears shooting team's India travelDespite boycotting the T20 World Cup in India over security concerns, the Bangladesh government has approved its shooting team's travel to New Delhi, citing the small size of the contingent and the controlled, indoor nature of the event.

Chasing Sincaraz? Novak Djokovic irked by reporter's question at Australian OpenNovak Djokovic hits back at a reporter calling a question about chasing Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz as disrespectful. Djokovic entered the Australian Open 2026 semi-final on Wednesday, January 28.

Sarfaraz Khan eyes India comeback with strong IPL season for Chennai Super KingsSarfaraz Khan believes his IPL stint with Chennai Super Kings can help revive his India ambitions, calling the opportunity to play alongside legends a crucial moment in his career.

Coach Stokes? England captain joins Lions' coaching setup for Pakistan tour: ReportBen Stokes and Moeen Ali will be joining the England Lions backroom staff for their upcoming series against Pakistan Shaheens, according to the latest report. Stokes is recovering from a groin injury he suffered during the Ashes series.

Leave Babar Azam alone: Pakistan captain not worried after poor Big Bash league stintSalman Ali Agha admitted that he is not worried about Babar Azam's form and wants the people to leave him alone after his poor stint in the BBL.

Jyothi Yarraji returns to training after 7 months out due to knee injuryIndia's leading hurdler Jyothi Yarraji has resumed track training after a seven-month injury layoff, confirming her comeback through a YouTube vlog as she begins her build-up toward a crucial 2026 season featuring major international events.

IND vs NZ: In-form Ishan Kishan misses Vizag T20I with niggle, no Shreyas IyerIn-form Ishan Kishan will sit out the Vizag T20I due to a niggle as India decided not to rope in Shreyas Iyer for the contest on Wednesday, January 28.

ICC vs Bangladesh 2.0? Bangladesh cricket board now slams U19 World Cup scheduleThe Bangladesh cricket board has initiated a new row with the International Cricket Council (ICC), this time with the scheduling for Bangladesh's matches during the ongoing U19 World Cup 2026.

Bangladesh find joy with Women's T20 World Cup berth after men's team setbackBangladesh have qualified for the Women's T20 World Cup after beating Thailand by 39 runs in the qualifiers in Nepal on Wednesday. The Netherlands also secured their berth for the first time in the tournament's history.

UP Warriorz rocked before playoffs with star batter ruled out with injuryWPL 2026: Phoebe Litchfield has been ruled out of the tournament due to injury, after which the UP Warriorz roped in Amy Jones as her replacement. The Warriorz are currently struggling at the bottom of the table with two matches left.

India witnessing unprecedented development in sports: President Droupadi MurmuPresident Droupadi Murmu was elated with India securing the hosting rights for the 2030 Commonwealth Games. Murmu credited the Narendra Modi government for aiding the push for sporting culture in the country.

Why Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's domestic games weren't televised: Devajit Saikia explainsBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia opened up on why Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's matches in the recently-concluded Vijay Hazare Trophy weren't televised. Kohli, back in domestic 50-over cricket after 15 years, hit 131 to become the fastest to 16,000 List A runs. Rohit scored 155 off 94 balls,  raising the tournament's profile.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
